授業目的:
The
objectives of this course are:

1.
To help students acquire English presentation/discussion skills

2.
To help students present their ideas clearly and effectively

3.
To help students think independently and critically 

4.
To provide students with opportunities to give English presentations on various
topics

5.
To help students become better audience members
到達目標:
1.
Students will develop speech-building strategies.

2.
Students will acquire better communication skills.

3.
Students will familiarize themselves with presentation/discussion techniques.

4.
Students will become more confident public speakers.
授業方法:
1. This course will be conducted in
English only and English will be the means of communication between the
students and the instructor.  (Students
will also be expected to communicate with one another in English.)

2. 
Students are encouraged to actively participate in class discussions,
both independently and collaboratively, in order to enhance their competence
and confidence in English and also to create a better learning environment for
all.

第1回: Course Description & Introduction
トピック.授業外学習2: One to two hours of homework can be expected each week.

成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading1: Students’ final grade will derive from a combination of assignments, activities, presentations, mini tests, etc.
成績評価Grading2: 備考　Note 1. Active participation is extremely importantand counts as a significant part of students’ evaluation marks.  2. Attendance is crucial to students’ successin this course. The instructor will carefully mark students’ attendance as present and on time, late, or absent. Specific rules regardingattendance are as follows: 2a) Onlystudents who are present at the time the class begins will receive fullattendance marks. 2b) Anystudent walking into the classroom after the class has begun will be markedlate. The instructor will take this into account when giving students aparticipation grade.2c) Being15 to 29 minutes late will equal half an absence (0.5). 2d) Eachtime students are late 30 minutes or more, theywill be marked absent. However, theyare still encouraged to attend.  2e) As ageneral rule, no more than three absenceswill be permitted in this course.
備考Note0:
In principle, the use
of smartphones, tablets, and other electronic devices in the classroom is
forbidden. Students must store them in their bags throughout the entire
duration of each class.  In the case of a
project in which internet connection is necessary, the instructor may instruct
students to use their electronic devices, but unless such a situation is
specifically and clearly suggested by the instructor, their use will be
strictly prohibited.

name: 【200】English Skills C　１／English Skills C
成績評価備考:
備考　Note
1. Active participation is extremely important and counts as a significant part of students’ evaluation marks. 
2. Attendance is crucial to students’ success in this course. The instructor will carefully mark students’ attendance as present and on time, late, or absent. Specific rules regarding attendance are as follows:
2a) Only students who are present at the time the class begins will receive full attendance marks.
2b) Any student walking into the classroom after the class has begun will be marked late. The instructor will take this into account when giving students a participation grade.
2c) Being 15 to 29 minutes late will equal half an absence (0.5).
2d) Each time students are late 30 minutes or more, they will be marked absent. However, they are still encouraged to attend. 
2e) As a general rule, no more than three absences will be permitted in this course.
